intro: Moehringia glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth moehringia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Moehringia glabrescens thrives in moist, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
